text:
<@U681ELA87> I'm running into something weird with `JSON3.jl` - I'm reading in a 258Mb JSON file, and `show`ing seems to freeze things:

```julia> mystr = read("test.json", String);

julia> results = JSON3.read(mystr)
JSON3.Object{Base.CodeUnits{UInt8, String}, Vector{UInt64}} with 1 entry:```
I don't get a prompt back, and I can't execute anything. I can ctrl-C to get the prompt back, and the object was successfully created, and I can access fields, though that often freezes too. If I end the line with a `;` to suppress printing, it's no problem.

```julia> results["BlastOutput2"]; # without semicolon, this freezes

julia> first(results["BlastOutput2"]) # this works, but takes about 4 seconds to get the prompt back
JSON3.Object{Base.CodeUnits{UInt8, String}, SubArray{UInt64, 1, Vector{UInt64}, Tuple{UnitRange{Int64}}, true}} with 1 entry:
  :report => {…

julia>```

text: Any way you can share the file with me so I can see what is causing the hang?
